author: Special Correspondent
text:
A large number of farmers staged a demonstration in front of the office of the Revenue Divisional Officer (RDO) in Attur town on Wednesday demanding the release of water from two reservoirs – Kariakoil dam and Aanaimadavu dam for carrying out irrigation activities in the tail end areas of River Vasishtanadhi.

The agitation was organised by the United Farmers Association – Tamil Nadu along with the River Vasishtanadhi water beneficiaries.

C. Palanimuthu, former MLA of Attur, led the agitation. T. Rajambal, a former MLA of Thalaivasal, C. Vaiyapuri, president of the United Farmers Association-Tamil Nadu, Govindarajan, a leader of Vivasayigal Sangam, spoke highlighting the demands.

Mr. Vaiyapuri said that refusing to release water from both the Kariakoil and Aanaimadavu dams, despite having adequate water, was against the riparian rights of tailend ayacutdars, and also against the regular crop pattern.

The agitation was in the interest of the suffering farming community of the tail-end ayacuts, Mr. Vaiyapuri said and called for farmers’ unity in this issue. He urged the district administration to take steps for the release of water from both the dams into River Vasishtanadhi. The water discharge should be continued till the water reached the tail-end areas of the district.
title: Farmers demand release of water from reservoirs
